results.brief_description: A story about a girl, her old coat, and why it is okay to be different. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’.

results.title: [Maryborough mudbrick dome]
results.brief_description:
Film showing the construction of a mudbrick hut with domed roof in Maryborough, central Victoria. The hut sits alongside the Maryborough Centenary Reserve, just off Stoneham Drive.

The hut was constructed during a week long workshop with Melbourne arhitecture students and local sustainability enthusiasts including Bill Mollison. The project was featured in ‘The Owner Builder” issue 5 and was overseen by Nepalese architect, Ramesh Manandhar, who is interviewed in the film.

The soundtrack is intermittent.

results.title: Frontline Afghanistan: A Tribute to Raffaele Favero (1945-83)
results.brief_description: A television documentary that pays tribute to Italian born camera operator, Raffaele Favero, who was killed while filming the war in Afghanistan. The film is also a very intimate account of the effect of his death on his wife and children in Australia.
results.title_for_label: Frontline Afghanistan: A Tribute to Raffaele Favero (1945-83)

results.title: The Ambassador
results.brief_description:
‘The Ambassador’, is a short film featuring veteran actor, Wynn Roberts (from Picnic At Hanging Rock) as a man who writes to the Minister for the Environment to advocate for the forests and the animals that live in them.

The film is built around real events: Wynn has lived much of his 95 years in the forest. It also references climate change, ongoing logging, the staggering loss of wildlife during the recent mega fires and showcases wildlife from the southeast forests. The film won the 2020 BVSC Best Environment Film Award.

Details on Wynn Roberts can be found here - https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0731687/?ref_=fn_al_nm_1

results.title: [Unidentified 16mm Film]

video_links.name: Uncredited footage, circa 1945, performances and parade.

results.brief_description: Film contains silent footage of various vaudeville and circus-style performances including dancing, acrobatics, slapstick comedy and more. The film also includes extensive footage of the British Navy marching in a street parade in Melbourne. One shot appears to be Elizabeth Street, featuring trams and the Flinders Street Station clocktower.

results.title: Wildcats and Pipedreams
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson and Kestrel Film & Television
results.brief_description: Wildcats and Pipedreams follows the crew of an oil drilling rig in the Timor Sea. It gives a fascinating insight into the lives of people living and working in a remote and difficult environment.

results.title: Green Fingers: Looking After Lemons
results.brief_description:
‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Looking After Lemons’, gardener Rod Cantrill shows ways to look after the popular lemon tree.

The narrator points out various issues that can afflict them including collar rot, leaf yellowing, leaf fall, and pests and diseases, while Cantrill works on lemon trees in a beautiful orchard. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.
